page.title: 14RIVER LIFE
page.content: The main{fish}in the{river}are brown trout and there are also grayling.The salmon and sea-trout are coming back to the river.This makes the river popular with anglers.The trout live from 4 to 5 years and they average 23 cm in length but fish up to 40 cm have been caught.Minnows, bullheads and stone loach can be found. There are various insects in the river such as Mayfly,Caddis Fly and Creeper (Stone Fly.) Mayfly live in fast streams and soon die if they are kept in water wamer than they are accustomed to.The Creeper's local name is Jock.It's Latin name is Perla carlukiana.The Creeper moults and after moulting 30 times in 3 years it surfaces and climbs on the bank.Its skin splits in the middle and the adult stonefly emerges.Freshwater crayfish are becoming more common.
